gw.api.database.upgrade.before

Class IBeforeUpgradeInsertSelectBuilder

  • gw.api.database.upgrade.before.IBeforeUpgradeInsertSelectBuilder

  • public class IBeforeUpgradeInsertSelectBuilder
    Performs an Insert-Select

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Set<String> MappedTargetColumns
      Returns an unmodifiable Set of the target columns that have already been mapped.
      IBeforeUpgradeQueryableTable SourceQueryableTable
      the table portion of the source. Use it to get references to columns (includes table alias).
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction SourceRestriction
      the restriction on the source
      IBeforeUpgradeTable TargetTable
      the table portion of the source. Use it to get references to columns (includes table alias).

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int execute()
      Executes the query. If already in a transaction, the query executes in that transaction; otherwise a new transaction is created and committed when the method returns, or rolled back if the method throws an exception. The statement that is constructed will perform default behavior for the following fields:- ID: using new keys from the KeyGenerator PublicID: default public id prefix followed by a ':' followed by the numeric ID BeanVersion: 0 CreateTime: current time CreateUser: the current user UpdateTime: current time UpdateUser: the current user Retired: 0 In a multi-threaded environment, you may get an exception if the number of rows updated does not match the expected row count (determined by the query portion of the statement). You may also get an exception regarding duplicate ID if the number of rows updated exceeds the expected row count as the statement may use IDs from other concurrent inserts.
      IBeforeUpgradeInsertSelectBuilder groupBy(Object[] columnsToGroupBy)
      Sets the group by columns
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction having()
      Returns the having restriction
      IBeforeUpgradeInsertSelectBuilder mapAllUnmappedColumns(boolean mapColumnsWithDefaults, Object[] exceptions)
      If the target table is associated with an entity, this method will map all unmapped columns in the target table to a column in the source table with the same name. If the source table does not have a column with that name, the column is not mapped. If the target table is not associated with an entity, this throws a SchemaTransformationException
      IBeforeUpgradeInsertSelectBuilder mapAllUnmappedColumns(Object[] exceptions)
      If the target table is associated with an entity, this method will map all unmapped columns in the target table to a column in the source table with the same name. If the source table does not have a column with that name, the column is not mapped. If the target table is not associated with an entity, this throws a SchemaTransformationException
      IBeforeUpgradeInsertSelectBuilder mapColumn(IBeforeUpgradeColumn targetColumn, IBeforeUpgradeQueryableTable subQuery, Object selectColumn)
      Maps the value of the target column to returned by the given query
      IBeforeUpgradeInsertSelectBuilder mapColumn(IBeforeUpgradeColumn targetColumn, Object source)
      Maps the value of the target column to the value of the source
      IBeforeUpgradeInsertSelectBuilder mapColumn(String targetColumn, Object source)
      Maps the value of the target column to the value of the source
      IBeforeUpgradeInsertSelectBuilder mapColumn(String targetColumn, IBeforeUpgradeQueryableTable subQuery, Object selectColumn)
      Maps the value of the target column to the value of the source
      IBeforeUpgradeInsertSelectBuilder withDescription(String descriptionForTheQuery)
      Sets a string describing the query. Useful for debugging performance issues.
      IBeforeUpgradeInsertSelectBuilder withDistinct(boolean withDistinct)
      Whether to use DISTINCT in the SELECT portion of the insert-select
      IBeforeUpgradeInsertSelectBuilder withInsertHint(boolean withInsertHint)
      Whether to append hint in the generated SQL
      IBeforeUpgradeInsertSelectBuilder withLogSQL(boolean logSQL)
      Turns on or off SQL logging. The query is logged to the PLLoggerCategory.SERVER_DATABASE log category at the info level
      IBeforeUpgradeInsertSelectBuilder withParallelDml(boolean useParallelDml)
      Use parallel DML when executing this statement (Oracle only). This behavior may be turned off globally in the configuration by setting the ora-parallel-dml attribute on the upgrade element to "disable". It may also be overridden with the parallel-dml attribute of the versiontrigger element.
      IBeforeUpgradeInsertSelectBuilder withSkipDefaultBehavior(boolean skip)
      This operation is able to set defaults for some well known fields, such as BeanVersion. However, before upgrade, this involves checking whether the column exists (we don't have metadata information). In some cases, this behavior is not desirable because of the cost to ping the database, e.g. in tests. Use true here if you have mapped all the desired fields and don't require the default behavior.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        int execute()
        Executes the query. If already in a transaction, the query executes in that transaction; otherwise a new transaction is created and committed when the method returns, or rolled back if the method throws an exception. The statement that is constructed will perform default behavior for the following fields:- ID: using new keys from the KeyGenerator PublicID: default public id prefix followed by a ':' followed by the numeric ID BeanVersion: 0 CreateTime: current time CreateUser: the current user UpdateTime: current time UpdateUser: the current user Retired: 0 In a multi-threaded environment, you may get an exception if the number of rows updated does not match the expected row count (determined by the query portion of the statement). You may also get an exception regarding duplicate ID if the number of rows updated exceeds the expected row count as the statement may use IDs from other concurrent inserts.
        Returns:
        the number of rows affected

      • groupBy

        IBeforeUpgradeInsertSelectBuilder groupBy(Object[] columnsToGroupBy)
        Sets the group by columns
        Parameters:
        columnsToGroupBy - Columns whose values we to group by. Can be IBeforeUpgradeColumn or String or IBeforeUpgradeColumnRef
        Returns:
        this

      • having

        IBeforeUpgradeRestriction having()
        Returns the having restriction
        Returns:

      • mapAllUnmappedColumns

        IBeforeUpgradeInsertSelectBuilder mapAllUnmappedColumns(boolean mapColumnsWithDefaults,
                                                      Object[] exceptions)
        If the target table is associated with an entity, this method will map all unmapped columns in the target table to a column in the source table with the same name. If the source table does not have a column with that name, the column is not mapped. If the target table is not associated with an entity, this throws a SchemaTransformationException
        Parameters:
        mapColumnsWithDefaults - whether to also map columns with defaults that do not exist in the source, but are on the target.
        exceptions - columns which should not be mapped anyway, e.g. when the user wants the default behavior. Can be Strings or IBeforeUpgradeColumns.
        Returns:
        this

      • mapAllUnmappedColumns

        IBeforeUpgradeInsertSelectBuilder mapAllUnmappedColumns(Object[] exceptions)
        If the target table is associated with an entity, this method will map all unmapped columns in the target table to a column in the source table with the same name. If the source table does not have a column with that name, the column is not mapped. If the target table is not associated with an entity, this throws a SchemaTransformationException
        Parameters:
        exceptions - columns which should not be mapped anyway, e.g. when the user wants the default behavior. Can be Strings or IBeforeUpgradeColumns.
        Returns:
        this

      • mapColumn

        IBeforeUpgradeInsertSelectBuilder mapColumn(IBeforeUpgradeColumn targetColumn,
                                          IBeforeUpgradeQueryableTable subQuery,
                                          Object selectColumn)
        Maps the value of the target column to returned by the given query
        Parameters:
        targetColumn - target column
        subQuery - IBeforeUpgradeQueryableTable instance to use in the subselect
        selectColumn - new value for the column (can be a IBeforeUpgradeColumnRef, a IBeforeUpgradeColumn, a String (for the column name), or a BeforeUpgradeDBFunction
        Returns:
        this

      • withParallelDml

        IBeforeUpgradeInsertSelectBuilder withParallelDml(boolean useParallelDml)
        Use parallel DML when executing this statement (Oracle only). This behavior may be turned off globally in the configuration by setting the ora-parallel-dml attribute on the upgrade element to "disable". It may also be overridden with the parallel-dml attribute of the versiontrigger element.
        Parameters:
        useParallelDml - whether to use Oracle parallel DML when executing this statement.
        Returns:
        this

      • withSkipDefaultBehavior

        IBeforeUpgradeInsertSelectBuilder withSkipDefaultBehavior(boolean skip)
        This operation is able to set defaults for some well known fields, such as BeanVersion. However, before upgrade, this involves checking whether the column exists (we don't have metadata information). In some cases, this behavior is not desirable because of the cost to ping the database, e.g. in tests. Use true here if you have mapped all the desired fields and don't require the default behavior.
        Parameters:
        skip - true to skip automated behavior
        Returns:
        this
